description: CRITICAL: Domain concepts must delegate responsibilities to the lowest-level object that can handle them. If a collection class can do something, delegate to it rather than implementing it in the parent.

content: Parent objects delegate to collection classes
Collection classes handle their own responsibilities directly
Responsibilities take what they need directly, not through parent
Correct Examples (delegation to lowest level):
WealthAdvisor
Find client by account: Client (delegates to Client)
Client (Collection Class)
Find by account id: AccountId (takes what it needs directly)
Portfolio
Find position by symbol: Holdings (delegates to Holdings)
Holdings (Collection Class)
Find by symbol: Symbol (takes what it needs directly)

dont.description: Don't implement responsibilities in parent when child can handle them
content: Don't have parent objects doing what child objects should do
Don't create unnecessary delegation chains
Wrong Examples (parent doing child's work):
WealthAdvisor
Find client by account: AccountId (WealthAdvisor doing what Client should do)
Find position by symbol: Portfolio, Symbol (WealthAdvisor doing what Holdings should do)
Client (Collection Class)
Find by account id: WealthAdvisor (wrong - should take AccountId directly)
Delegation Violation Indicators (REJECT):
- Parent objects implementing responsibilities that belong to child objects
- Collection classes taking parent objects as parameters instead of what they need directly
- Unnecessary delegation chains (A delegates to B which delegates to C)
